        "title": "Vermont? Seriously? - GitHub CEO resigns as CoreAI takes over",
        "description": "Patch Tuesday was yesterday, so find out what\u0027s new! Plus, two of the best-ever Doom engine games are now available in remastered form (4K/120 FPS, new episodes, cross-play, multiplayer, more) on Game Pass, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox PC (Windows), PS4, PS5, Switch, Steam, GOG, and various cloud streaming services. It\u0027s a free update if you already own either game. Also, if you have a local library, \u00A0you should use it. If only for Libby by Overdrive free audiobooks and free access to periodicals. But then be surprised by all the services they offer!\n\nWindows 11\n\u2022 Copilot\u002B PCs: Recall comes to the EU, Recall Reset, Click to Do improvements, AI agent in Settings\n\u2022 All: Quick Machine Recovery, black screen of death, Snap layouts improvements, Gamepad layout for Windows Touch Keyboard\n\u2022 Blender is now native on Windows 11 on Arm\n\u2022 Search settings consolidation in Canary\n\u2022 Mobile device companion sidebar for Start gets a new layout in Dev\n\u2022 More Control Panel settings move to Settings app in Dev and Beta\n\nWindows 10\n\u2022 Consumer ESU licenses will support up to 10 PCs\n\u2022 Microsoft will support Edge on Windows 10 through October 2028 (as expected)\n\nAI\n\u2022 OpenAI releases GPT-5 but not everyone loves it\n\u2022 Quickly brought back GPT-4o\n\u2022 And now the model picker is back, for now\n\u2022 Microsoft is adding it everywhere, of course, and Apple says it will add to Apple Intelligence - And Bing just added support for GPT-4o image creation\n\u2022 Perplexity makes unsolicited $34.5 billion bid for Google Chrome\n\u2022 Comet - New tab page with Chat, can choose a Google Search as you type, Assistant in a sidebar, Summarize webpage/document, voice dictation, voice mode, big feature is website interactivity\n\u2022 Microsoft Edge in Copilot Mode - most evolutionary update, new New Tab page, Quick assist with Copilot button location change, Simple task handoff (which needs work), Voice navigation\n\u2022 But some bigger UI changes are on the way\n\u2022 Dia (Mac only for now) - Also, there\u2019s a Pro subscription - New Tab page with chat and an attempt at orchestration, @mentions for tabs, Skills (built-in, can edit, can make you\u2019re own), and personalization\n\u2022 Next up: Opera Neon \u00A0- And what is Google doing with Chrome?\n\u2022 Copilot 3D can turn images into 3D models - It\u2019s a \u201CCreators Update\u201D!\n\u2022 Microsoft is EOLing the Lens app - use Microsoft Copilot 365 app instead\n\nMicrosoft/Surface\n\u2022 GitHub CEO is leaving, Microsoft is rolling GitHub into its Core AI organization\n\u2022 Surface Laptop 7 and Surface Pro 11 get firmware update to add battery charging modes\n\nXbox and games\n\u2022 Sony sold 2.5 million PS5s in quarter, now over 80 million cumulatively\n\u2022 Microsoft rumored to have sold only 21 to 29 million Xbox Series X|S consoles\n\u2022 Big Windows 11 on Arm updates!\n\u2022 Game downloading is coming to Xbox app on Windows 11 on Arm\n\u2022 Epic Games and Qualcomm bring Easy Anti-Cheat to Windows 11 on Arm/Snapdragon X\n\u2022 Apple and Google have illegal mobile app store monopolies in Australia, so Fortnite is coming back to the iPhone there via Epic Games Store\n\u2022 Microsoft is updating Xbox Dashboard and app to show game trials and demos in \u201CFree with Xbox\u201D section\n\u2022 Microsoft has paused the production of Contraband\n\u2022 Steam for Chromebooks Beta will never leave beta, discontinuing in January instead\n\nTips \u0026 Picks\n\u2022 Tip of the week: Go to the library\n\u2022 App pick of the week: Heretic and Hexen Remasters!\n\u2022 RunAs Radio this week: The Power of the Graph with Tony Redmond\n\u2022 Brown liquor pick of the week: Union Horse Rivalist\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 945\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/945\n\nSponsors:\n\u2022 bitwarden.com/twit\n\u2022 helixsleep.com/twit\n\u2022 threatlocker.com/twit\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul\u0027s blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access. And Bing just added support for GPT-4o image creation\n\u2022 Perplexity makes unsolicited $34.5 billion bid for Google Chrome\n\u2022 Comet - New tab page with Chat, can choose a Google Search as you type, Assistant in a sidebar, Summarize webpage/document, voice dictation, voice mode, big feature is website interactivity\n\u2022 Microsoft Edge in Copilot Mode - most evolutionary update, new New Tab page, Quick assist with Copilot button location change, Simple task handoff (which needs work), Voice navigation\n\u2022 But some bigger UI changes are on the way\n\u2022 Dia (Mac only for now) - Also, there\u2019s a Pro subscription - New Tab page with chat and an attempt at orchestration, @mentions for tabs, Skills (built-in, can edit, can make you\u2019re own), and personalization\n\u2022 Next up: Opera Neon \u00A0- And what is Google doing with Chrome?\n\u2022 Copilot 3D can turn images into 3D models - It\u2019s a \u201CCreators Update\u201D!\n\u2022 Microsoft is EOLing the Lens app - use Microsoft Copilot 365 app instead\n\nMicrosoft/Surface\n\u2022 GitHub CEO is leaving, Microsoft is rolling GitHub into its Core AI organization\n\u2022 Surface Laptop 7 and Surface Pro 11 get firmware update to add battery charging modes\n\nXbox and games\n\u2022 Sony sold 2.5 million PS5s in quarter, now over 80 million cumulatively\n\u2022 Microsoft rumored to have sold only 21 to 29 million Xbox Series X|S consoles\n\u2022 Big Windows 11 on Arm updates!\n\u2022 Game downloading is coming to Xbox app on Windows 11 on Arm\n\u2022 Epic Games and Qualcomm bring Easy Anti-Cheat to Windows 11 on Arm/Snapdragon X\n\u2022 Apple and Google have illegal mobile app store monopolies in Australia, so Fortnite is coming back to the iPhone there via Epic Games Store\n\u2022 Microsoft is updating Xbox Dashboard and app to show game trials and demos in \u201CFree with Xbox\u201D section\n\u2022 Microsoft has paused the production of Contraband\n\u2022 Steam for Chromebooks Beta will never leave beta, discontinuing in January instead\n\nTips \u0026 Picks\n\u2022 Tip of the week: Go to the library\n\u2022 App pick of the week: Heretic and Hexen Remasters!\n\u2022 RunAs Radio this week: The Power of the Graph with Tony Redmond\n\u2022 Brown liquor pick of the week: Union Horse Rivalist\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 945\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/945\n\nSponsors:\n\u2022 bitwarden.com/twit\n\u2022 helixsleep.com/twit\n\u2022 threatlocker.com/twit\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul\u0027s blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.         "title": "Balancing Coupling in Software Design \u2022 Vlad Khononov \u0026 Sheen Brisals",
        "description": "This interview was recorded for the GOTO Book Club.\nhttp://gotopia.tech/bookclub\n\nRead the full transcription of the interview here\n (https://gotopia.tech/episodes/367) \nSheen Brisals - AWS Serverless Hero, Engineering Leader \u0026 Co-Author of \u0022Serverless Development on AWS\u0022\nVlad Khononov - Author of \u0022Balancing Coupling in Software Design\u0022 \u0026 \u0022Learning Domain Driven Design\u0022 \u0026 Creator of the Balanced Coupling Model\n\nRESOURCES\nVlad\nhttps://bsky.app/profile/vladikk.bsky.social\nhttps://vladikk.com\nhttps://github.com/vladikk\nhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/vladikk\n\nSheen\nhttps://bsky.app/profile/sheenbrisals.bsky.social\nhttps://twitter.com/sheenbrisals\nhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/sheen-brisals\nhttps://sbrisals.medium.com\n\nLinks\nhttps://www.informit.com\nhttps://youtu.be/6hTZXR2brWE\n\nDESCRIPTION\nSheen Brisals sits down with software engineer and author Vlad Khononov to explore his latest book, \u0022Balancing Coupling in Software Design\u0022. Vlad shares his journey from a failed microservices project to his deep dive into the principles of coupling, drawing insights from a 1970s structured design book.\n\nThe duo discusses the timeless nature of coupling in software, how modern systems like microservices and cloud architectures still rely on age-old design principles, and the importance of understanding complexity for better problem decomposition and estimation. Vlad also reveals his unique approach to the book\u2014integrating AI-generated poetry into each chapter to help readers grasp complex concepts. With a focus on modularity as the antidote to complexity, Vlad emphasizes that by managing coupling, engineers can create more maintainable, scalable systems.\n\nRECOMMENDED BOOKS\nVlad Khononov \u2022 Balancing Coupling in Software Design\n (https://amzn.to/4iGpbDv) Vlad Khononov \u2022 Learning Domain-Driven Design\n (https://amzn.to/41EVhIX) Sheen Brisals \u0026 Luke Hedger \u2022 Serverless Development on AWS\n (https://amzn.to/3W3Sw2f) Glenford Myers \u2022 Composite/Structured Design\n (https://amzn.to/4kVblPN) Vaughn Vernon \u2022 Implementing Domain-Driven Design\n (https://amzn.to/41Mpk2E) Eric Evans \u2022 Domain-Driven Design\n (https://amzn.to/43lNxhv) van Kelle, Verschatse \u0026 Baas-Schwegler \u2022 Collaborative Software Design\n (https://amzn.to/4iv0N8I) Nick Tune \u0026 Jean-Georges Perrin \u2022 Architecture Moderniza (https://amzn.to/4b5ASiN) \n\n\nBluesky (https://bsky.app/profile/gotocon.com) \nTwitter (https://twitter.com/GOTOcon) \nInstagram (https://www.instagram.com/goto_con) \nLinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/goto-) \nFacebook (https://www.facebook.com/GOTOConferences) \n\nCHANNEL MEMBERSHIP BONUS\nJoin this channel to get early access to videos \u0026 other perks:\nhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCs_tLP3AiwYKwdUHpltJPuA/join\n\nLooking for a unique learning experience?\nAttend the next GOTO conference near you!             "title": "Turbulence Canceling Technology Could Make the Skies Smoother for Aircraft – AIN",
            "description": "Turbulence Solutions has demonstrated its real-time Turbulence Cancelling System (TCS) aboard a piloted test aircraft, showing more than 80% reduction in turbulence-induced vertical acceleration. Designed for use in both fixed-wing and advanced air mobility (AAM) aircraft, the technology uses sensors on the leading edge of the aircraft’s wing and active control surface deflections to counteract turbulent air in real time.\n\nThe company’s demonstrator aircraft—a Shark 600 dubbed Steady Eddy—has flown public demo missions and made appearances at Aero Friedrichshafen in Germany and Australia's Avalon 2025.\n\nUsing real-time differential pressure sensors positioned on the leading edge of the aircraft’s wings, the TCS system anticipates incoming turbulence and responds with control surface movements that dampen vertical motion. Flight data from a test campaign with a Colomban MC-30 Luciole showed a drop in measured vertical g-loads from 0.4 g to 0.1 g, and root mean square acceleration reduced from 1.31 m/s² to below 0.39 m/s².\n\nThe company aims to get this system onto larger aircraft like airliners and business jets. During the recent Aero Friedrichshafen show in Germany, Amy Wilder got a chance to see the technology demonstrator firsthand. \n\n___________________________________________________\n\nVisit http://www.ainonline.com for all the latest on the aviation industry, and *AIN* sister site http://bjtonline.com for the most comprehensive resource available for anyone using—or interested in trying—private flight.             "channelId": "UC3sUXXXvm0BcU8MS3KcXOig",
            "title": "Sikorsky S-92 Helicopters Get a Second Life as Firefighters – AIN",
            "description": "The world’s first firefighting-configured Sikorsky S-92A made its public debut at the Verticon 2025 trade show earlier this year. Developed by S-92 lessor Milestone Aviation in cooperation with operator VIH Helicopters, it marks the first such-configured S-92 available to the commercial market.\n\nThe program was launched last summer in British Columbia with the assistance of government wildfire management agencies.\n\nAccording to the companies, this S-92A has the capacity to carry up to 19 passengers, internal/external cargo, or 5,000 liters (1,320 gallons) of water in the expandable belly-mounted custom-built Helitak carbon fiber tank. The external tank weighs less than 700 pounds empty and is supplemental type certificated for the large-cabin helicopter. With its snorkel, it can fully fill from a body of water in just 48 seconds and can be removed from the helicopter in less than 30 minutes.\n\nOther features include a lighter cabin interior, bubble window on the pilot side to enable more precise water drops and increased visibility when refilling, and exterior power gauge mounted just below this window for use during refilling.\n\nVIH Aerospace is performing the reconfiguration in-house, a process that takes approximately four months. COO Jen Norie noted it has received a lot of interest in the conversion, and VIH expects to have three converted S-92s operational by the third quarter.\n\n“We’re seeing these wonderful aircraft coming off of the offshore service after 20 years still with lots of life left in them, and so that’s why we’re doing this program to reconfigure them,” said Norie, who sees this as a growing product line for the company. “There’s going to be more and more of them—it’s going to be the future of the business.”\n\nThere are currently more than 260 S-92s in service. Its airframe has a life-limit of 30,000 hours, according to Leon Silva, Sikorsky’s v-p of global commercial and military systems.\n\n“We expect that the customer’s will keep the [S-92] aircraft in the high utilization missions for example, offshore where they are flying 1,500-to 2,000 hours a year and then when the aircraft gets close to the end of its life, then you are flying a couple hundred hours a year with one of these and then use it for another 10 years,” Silva told AIN.\n\n___________________________________________________\n\nVisit http://www.ainonline.com for all the latest on the aviation industry, and *AIN* sister site http://bjtonline.com for the most comprehensive resource available for anyone using—or interested in trying—private flight.             "publishedAt": "2025-05-16T20:16:44Z",
            "channelId": "UC3sUXXXvm0BcU8MS3KcXOig",
            "title": "We Experience the Cirrus SR Series G7+, the First Autoland-equipped Piston Aircraft – AIN",
            "description": "Cirrus has announced the launch of the new SR series G7+, the first piston-single aircraft to be equipped with Garmin’s Safe Return Emergency Autoland system.\n\nFor use in emergency situations such as pilot incapacitation, the Collier Award-winning system will assume control of the in-flight aircraft at the touch of a button, transmit emergency alerts to air traffic control, navigate to the nearest suitable airport, and land autonomously, all the while issuing instructions and status updates to passengers via the aircraft’s cockpit data screens. The system will then bring the aircraft to a stop on the runway center line, shut down the engine, and instruct occupants when it is safe to exit.\n\nIn instances where the pilot is the lone occupant, Safe Return will passively monitor their flight patterns, and if it detects an erratic or dangerous operation, it will first query the pilot before assuming control and landing the airplane. If a pilot regains the ability to safely aviate, they can disengage the system at any point.\n\nSafe Return is now standard equipment on all new-build Cirrus SR Series G7+ airplanes, part of an upgrade suite that also includes automatic database updates powered by Cirrus IQ Pro, runway occupancy awareness, and smart pitot heat.\n\nAutoland was first approved for use by the FAA in the Piper M600 SLS turboprop single in 2020, followed by the Daher TBM 940 (since proceeded by the TBM 960), Cirrus SF50 Vision Jet, and Beechcraft King Air 200 and 300-series turboprop twins.\n\nCirrus brings the technology to an “entry-level” piston aircraft for the first time, exposing a wider set of pilots and passengers to this technology.\n\n___________________________________________________\n\nVisit http://www.ainonline.com for all the latest on the aviation industry, and *AIN* sister site http://bjtonline.com for the most comprehensive resource available for anyone using—or interested in trying—private flight.               "description": "Cirrus has announced the launch of the new SR series G7+, the first piston-single aircraft to be equipped with Garmin’s Safe Return Emergency Autoland system.\n\nFor use in emergency situations such as pilot incapacitation, the Collier Award-winning system will assume control of the in-flight aircraft at the touch of a button, transmit emergency alerts to air traffic control, navigate to the nearest suitable airport, and land autonomously, all the while issuing instructions and status updates to passengers via the aircraft’s cockpit data screens. The system will then bring the aircraft to a stop on the runway center line, shut down the engine, and instruct occupants when it is safe to exit.\n\nIn instances where the pilot is the lone occupant, Safe Return will passively monitor their flight patterns, and if it detects an erratic or dangerous operation, it will first query the pilot before assuming control and landing the airplane. If a pilot regains the ability to safely aviate, they can disengage the system at any point.\n\nSafe Return is now standard equipment on all new-build Cirrus SR Series G7+ airplanes, part of an upgrade suite that also includes automatic database updates powered by Cirrus IQ Pro, runway occupancy awareness, and smart pitot heat.\n\nAutoland was first approved for use by the FAA in the Piper M600 SLS turboprop single in 2020, followed by the Daher TBM 940 (since proceeded by the TBM 960), Cirrus SF50 Vision Jet, and Beechcraft King Air 200 and 300-series turboprop twins.\n\nCirrus brings the technology to an “entry-level” piston aircraft for the first time, exposing a wider set of pilots and passengers to this technology.\n\n___________________________________________________\n\nVisit http://www.ainonline.com for all the latest on the aviation industry, and *AIN* sister site http://bjtonline.com for the most comprehensive resource available for anyone using—or interested in trying—private flight.             "description": "Gulfstream Aerospace business jets have racked up 700 city-pair records, with the latest involving a flight of its flagship G700 from Taipei to Miami. In addition to the milestone, the flight commemorates the 50-year anniversary of its first U.S. National Aeronautic Association-accredited speed record that the Gulfstream GII established in 1975 on a flight from St. John’s, Antigua, to Dakar, Senegal. During the most recent record, on April 1, the G700 flew 7,740 nm in 14 hours 38 minutes, averaging a cruise speed of Mach 0.87.\n\nWe visit Gulfstream's Manhattan design center to witness the record ceremony, and to catch up with the company's President, Mark Burns.\n___________________________________________________\n\nVisit http://www.ainonline.com for all the latest on the aviation industry, and *AIN* sister site http://bjtonline.com for the most comprehensive resource available for anyone using—or interested in trying—private flight.             "title": "OpenAI's UAE Data Center, AT&T-Lumen Consumer Fiber Deal | Bloomberg Technology",
            "description": "Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow talk to OpenAI’s Global Policy President Chris Lehane about the company’s plans to build more international data centers.             "description": "This week Meta held its first-ever AI dev conference, LlamaCon, focused on the development of its Llama generative AI model.             "title": "Box CEO Aaron Levie on AI agents, enterprise data, and the future of work",
            "description": "Box CEO and co-founder Aaron Levie joins the GeekWire Podcast to talk about the company’s latest AI initiatives, including a new integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot and a suite of Box AI agents designed to help businesses analyze content, extract data, and generate insights. \n \n\nLevie shares how AI is changing the way he and his team work, explains why he believes 2025 is still “day one” for enterprise AI agents, and offers a realistic take on what AI can — and can’t — do today.             "description": "This week on the GeekWire Podcast: The rapid acceleration of artificial intelligence takes center stage in business technology spending, in Washington D.C., and in the global tech power struggle.\n \n\nWe break down a headline-grabbing U.S. Senate hearing on AI and U.S.–China competitiveness, featuring testimony from Microsoft’s Brad Smith and OpenAI’s Sam Altman. Ted Cruz's opening statement.\n \n\nPlus, we dive into a new global survey from Amazon Web Services showing just how quickly companies are making generative AI their top tech priority — even ahead of cybersecurity.\n \n\nU.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation: Winning the AI Race: Strengthening U.S. Capabilities in Computing and Innovation (https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2025/5/winning-the-ai-race-strengthening-u-s-capabilities-in-computing-and-innovation_2) \n \n      \n  •  OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: ChatGPT will ‘probably not’ replace Google as top search engine (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/openai-ceo-sam-altman-says-chatgpt-will-probably-not-replace-google-as-main-search-engine/) \n      \n  •  Previously: Microsoft asks Trump to loosen chip export limits (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/microsoft-asks-trump-to-loosen-chip-export-limits-to-avoid-giving-china-an-ai-advantage/) \n      \n  •  Bloomberg: Trump plans to rescind AI chip export curbs (https://www.bloomberg.com) \n       \n\nAmazon Web Services Generative AI Adoption Index (https://press.aboutamazon.com/aws/2025/5/generative-ai-adoption-index) \n \n      \n  •  Generative AI tops cybersecurity in 2025 tech budget priorities, new AWS study finds (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/generative-ai-tops-cybersecurity-in-2025-tech-budget-priorities-new-aws-study-finds/) \n       \n\nWith GeekWire co-founders Todd Bishop and John Cook.\n\n\nSee omnystudio.com/listener (https://omnystudio.com/listener)  for privacy information.",

There was also a fun Seattle tech callback in the form of a hot-mic moment from Sen. Maria Cantwell during Sen. Ted Cruz's opening statement.\n \n\nPlus, we dive into a new global survey from Amazon Web Services showing just how quickly companies are making generative AI their top tech priority — even ahead of cybersecurity.\n \n\nU.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation: Winning the AI Race: Strengthening U.S. Capabilities in Computing and Innovation (https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2025/5/winning-the-ai-race-strengthening-u-s-capabilities-in-computing-and-innovation_2) \n \n      \n  •  OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: ChatGPT will ‘probably not’ replace Google as top search engine (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/openai-ceo-sam-altman-says-chatgpt-will-probably-not-replace-google-as-main-search-engine/) \n      \n  •  Previously: Microsoft asks Trump to loosen chip export limits (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/microsoft-asks-trump-to-loosen-chip-export-limits-to-avoid-giving-china-an-ai-advantage/) \n      \n  •  Bloomberg: Trump plans to rescind AI chip export curbs (https://www.bloomberg.com) \n       \n\nAmazon Web Services Generative AI Adoption Index (https://press.aboutamazon.com/aws/2025/5/generative-ai-adoption-index) \n \n      \n  •  Generative AI tops cybersecurity in 2025 tech budget priorities, new AWS study finds (https://www.geekwire.com/2025/generative-ai-tops-cybersecurity-in-2025-tech-budget-priorities-new-aws-study-finds/) \n       \n\nWith GeekWire co-founders Todd Bishop and John Cook.\n\n\nSee omnystudio.com/listener (https://omnystudio.com/listener)  for privacy information."
            },

            "description": "Azeem Azhar’s mission is to help leaders stay ahead of the curve at a time when technology, especially AI, is evolving at an exponential rate. He founded the Exponential View newsletter, which offers insights and advice to an eager audience of 116,000+ people who want to get ahead in a rapidly changing world. He joined us to discuss the potential for AI to help business leaders navigate uncertainty and describe some of the ways that AI agents and deep research will fundamentally change the way we work. \n\nFind this episode on:  \n- Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/worklab/id1582908812\n- Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/2vApnLW5XfXoP8WDYGzFkT\n- WorkLab Podcast: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/worklab/podcast/\n\nWorkLab air date: March 4, 2025\nChapters\n00:00 - About WorkLab\n00:33 - Overview of Exponential View\n02:04 - Adapting to Fast-Changing Technologies\n03:48 - Contrarian Ideas about GenAI in the Workplace\n05:58 - AI Assistants vs. AI Agents\n08:40 - Impact of AI Agents on Business\n10:28 - Leadership and Adaptation\n13:09 - AI as a Light Bulb vs. AI as a Factory\n14:14 - Navigating Other Disruptions with AI\n16:46 - Difference Between Data and Knowledge\n18:27 - Unexpected Uses of AI\n20:31 - Challenges and Opportunities of AI at Work\n21:14 - Future of Work with AI\n\nAbout the WorkLab Podcast:\nJoin host Molly Wood as she explores what leaders need to know to prepare their organizations for the innovations and disruptions that are transforming the way we work.             "description": "• Canon printer driver vulnerabilities enable Windows kernel exploitation.\n• Astonishing cyber-security awareness from a household appliance manufacturer.\n• France tries to hook 2.5 million school children with a Phishing test.\n• Wordpress added an abuse prone feature in 2022.             "title": "Kenya has a White Founder Problem",
            "description": "An analysis of data gathered by the Startup Soko team reveals a stark difference in the funding received by startups led by local founders versus those led by expatriates or foreign founders. Is it a question of pedigree, access, or unconscious bias?           "id": "K-vsakGJhEM",
          "snippet": {
            "publishedAt": "2025-05-19T14:00:27Z",
            "channelId": "UCiDJtJKMICpb9B1qf7qjEOA",
            "title": "Adam Savage Visits Where Hollywood Gets Its Spacesuits!",
            "description": "Adam spends the day visiting Global Effects (@Diligent_Dwarves ) the legendary specialty costume shop where spacesuits and armor from decades of Hollywood films were created. Founder Chris Gilman tours Adam through the company's historical spacesuit department, the home to over 300 spacesuit replicas that he and his team have fabricated for use in films, TV shows, and other productions.             "title": "Adam Savage's First Look at a UV 3D Printer! (EufyMake E1)",

            "title": "Should Open Source Developers Worry About EU Cyber Resilience Act?",
            "description": "Michael Lieberman, CTO and Co-Founder of Kusari, breaks down the European Union's Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) and explains its impact on open source maintainers, stewards, and manufacturers. In this insightful interview, discover:\n\nWhy open source maintainers are \"off the hook\" for CRA compliance\nHow commercial product manufacturers bear primary responsibility\nWhat practical tools like OpenSSF Security Baseline can help with compliance\nWhich types of digital products fall under CRA jurisdiction (and which don't)\nHow the CRA might positively reshape security practices in open source\nLieberman clarifies: \"The obligation will be on ACME Corp to do the right things—adding patches themselves if necessary, and working with me.\" He highlights how organizations like the Linux Foundation serve as \"open source stewards\" to help foster community-driven security solutions.\nWant to improve your project's security posture? Lieberman recommends tools like OpenSSF Scorecard that \"can help  apply baseline rules and enforce that for all projects.\"\n\nThis conversation is essential viewing for open source contributors, security professionals, and technology leaders navigating the evolving regulatory landscape.\nTimestamps\n00:00 - Introduction to CRA\n01:25 - Definition and purpose of CRA \n02:46 - Open source maintainer obligations \n09:51 - Security tools for compliance \n13:49 - Clarifying responsibilities \n19:57 - Global regulatory landscape \n24:25 - Positive impacts on security collaboration\n#CyberResilience #OpenSourceSecurity #CRA #EuropeanRegulation #CyberSecurity #OpenSource #SecurityCompliance #LinuxFoundation #OpenSSF #SoftwareSecurity #TechRegulation #CyberLaw",

            "title": "LF Live Webinar: From CI to Kubernetes Catalog: A Practical Guide to vCluster and GitOps",
            "description": "Sponsored by: vCluster\n\nModern platform engineering requires more than just Kubernetes – it’s about building a cohesive ecosystem that supports developer autonomy and operational scalability. In this session, we’ll walk through how to build a self-service Kubernetes catalog using Helm, GitOps, and vCluster, while integrating CI pipelines and composable infrastructure tools like Terraform, Helm, Kro, Kratix, etc. Learn how to connect these components into a seamless platform experience that’s ready for real-world, day-2 operations.\n\nTopics we’ll cover include:\n\n- How can you build a Helm-based catalog that empowers teams to deploy services on their own?\n- What does it mean to “compose” infrastructure using tools like Terraform, Kratix, and Score?\n- How does label-based deployment work in Argo CD, especially across multiple vClusters?\n- How can Go-based templates and CI pipelines generate deploy-ready manifests for GitOps?\n- What does a fully integrated GitOps workflow look like from CI to production?",

            "title": "The CRA Explained—Why It Matters to Open Source Developers and Vendors",
            "description": "The European Union's Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) is a regulation that applies to products with digital elements, including software and hardware. In this video, David A. Wheeler, Director of Open Source Supply Chain Security at OpenSSF, explains the CRA and its implications for software developers and organizations.\n\nThe CRA mandates risk identification, vulnerability management, and documentation, making it a significant shift from the status quo. Penalties for non-compliance can reach up to 15 million euros or 15% of annual revenue. OpenSSF has released a free, self-paced course to help software developers and managers understand and comply with the CRA.\n\nWatch to learn more about the CRA and how to prepare for its enforcement in 2026 and 2027. Understand the importance of early preparation and how to ensure compliance with the CRA.",

              "title": "Fuji X Half hands-on: the most analogue digital camera",
              "description": "Fujifilm’s new X Half camera is quirky, limited, and kind of fascinating. It ditches modern features like RAW, EVF and stabilization in favor of film-like charm, a small 1-inch sensor, built-in filters, and a digital “film advance” lever. It’s not for everyone — (mainly because of its price) but if you love capturing scrappy, spontaneous moments, this might be your new favorite camera.             "title": "A Lot of Goodwill to Squander - Apple TV+, WWDC 2025, App Store",
            "description": "Apple is reportedly losing $1 billion a year on Apple TV+. WWDC 2025 has officially been announced. New features are coming to macOS 15.4 soon. Leo gets excited about a quiet update to the HomePod mini... the boxes that the devices come in that is. And would you buy an Apple-branded USB-C to 3.5mm cable for your AirPods Max?\n\n• Apple is apparently losing $1 billion a year on its TV+ streaming service.\n• Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference returns the week of June 9.\n• Tim, don’t kill my vibe.\n• Apple Music Classical gets three new features to aid discovery & learning.\n• Construction begins on delayed Apple TV+ studios.\n• macOS 15.4: Four new features are coming to your Mac soon.\n• Apple has quietly updated the HomePod mini with a new box.\n• All iPhone 18 models rumored to get speed boost from 2nm chips.\n• PSA: This is one of the most sophisticated phishing attacks ever made against Mac users.\n• Netflix will stream shows and movies in HDR10+ on supported devices.\n• Apple’s rumored plastic Apple Watch SE has reportedly hit a serious snag.\n• Apple now sells USB-C to 3.5 mm cable for wired AirPods Max playback.\n• Porch pirate criminal network stole thousands of iPhones in the U.S.\n• EU orders Apple to open up access to iOS notifications, allow alternatives to AirDrop and AirPlay on the iPhone.\n• Season 3 of “Severance” is a go, via Tim Cook’s cute Twitter convo with Ben Stiller.\n• Jason Bourne franchise shopped as rights leave Universal.\n• Professional DJs can now use Apple Music tracks directly.\n\nPicks of the Week:\n• Jason's Pick: Insta360 Link 1\n• Andy's Pick: Adafruit Fruit Jam and Pico-Mac emulator (in development)\n• Alex's Pick: Playlisty\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Alex Lindsay, Andy Ihnatko, and Jason Snell\nMacBreak Weekly Episode 965\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/macbreak-weekly/episodes/965\n\nSponsor:\n• zocdoc.com/macbreak\n\nDownload or subscribe to MacBreak Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/macbreak-weekly\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "title": "Live from Build - Protestors, AI agents, Edit, Doom: The Dark Ages",
            "description": "Agentic AI is the theme of the show this year, and this time its multi-agent with orchestration! But first, we need to discuss the protestors. Paul and Richard have stories. So many stories!\n\nBuild 2025\n• New Microsoft 365 Copilot features are rolling out now because it’s a day that ends in y\n• Tuning is the unexpected Build Bingo center square term - rolling out to agents\n• GitHub Copilot is open source in VS Code, more\n• Win32 app support improvements, no more fees in Microsoft Store\n• A shift in making Windows 11 the best place for developers - some things said, some left unsaid\n• Edge gets new AI features too of course\n• New native app capabilities in Windows App SDK, React Native\n• And, pre-Build, 50 million Visual Studio users\n• Copilot for consumers does image generation now. Fun tip: You can Minecraft-ize photos\n• OpenAI has a coding agent too, obviously \n• And OpenAI is buying Jony Ive!\n\nWindows \n• Administrator Protection is coming soon - And not just for businesses. This feels very much like the firewall in XP SP2, it’s going to be disruptive\n• New 24H2 features in Release Preview: New text actions in Click to Do, a lot more\n• New 24H2 features in Dev and Beta: AI actions in File Explorer, Advanced Settings, Search improvements, more \n• New 23H2 features, Windows 10 features in Release Preview\n• Surface Laptop Studio RIP\n• Calendar companion app for Windows 11/M365\n• Microsoft may finally put the Teams antitrust issue in the EU behind\n\nXbox\n• Fortnite returns to the Apple App Store\n• Apple blocked it first, Epic complained to judge\n• And Microsoft files a legal motion against Apple and for Epic Games\n• Qualcomm job listing confirms Xbox plans to some degree\n• What happens when you combine Qualcomm NPU with Nvidia GPU?\n• Xbox May Update arrives and it’s a big one\n• Retro Classic Games for Xbox Game Pass\n• Game Bar updates, Edge Game Assist, GeForce now etc. on PC\n• Custom Xbox gift cards\n• More streaming of your own games \n• Hellblade II is coming from Xbox to PS5\n• Many more games coming to Xbox Game Pass across platforms\n\nTips and Picks\n• App pick of the week: You can try Microsoft’s command line editor now\n• Game pick of the week: Doom: The Dark Ages\n• RunAs Radio this week: PowerShell 7.5 and DSC 3.0.0 with Jason Helmick\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: Tamnavulin Sherry Cask\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 933\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/933\n\nSponsors:\n• spaceship.com/twit\n• uscloud.com\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "publishedAt": "2025-05-15T00:53:50Z",
            "channelId": "UC1WHdBv9P5tYEGfy-btvYfA",
            "title": "The Last Australian - Microsoft lays off 3%, Windows 10 ESU, \"Hey Copilot\"",
            "description": "It’s go time: The biggest Patch Tuesday of 2025 sets the stage for 2025! Microsoft has finally revealed whether it will further extend Windows 10 support past October (it won't). Also, Microsoft designed notifications in Windows 11 to be annoying and pointless, so Paul has some advice. Plus, Proton Drive gets a long awaited albums feature, and more on the way.\n\nWindows 11\n• Recall (preview) and Click to Do (preview) come to stable for the first time\n• Let’s give Microsoft a bit of credit for this one non-reported behavior\n• Also: Improvements to Settings, Narrator, Start, Phone Link, Widgets, File Explorer\n• You knew this was coming: Microsoft now testing a “Hey, Copilot” feature\n• It’s opt-in and an alternative to holding down Alt + Spacebar for two seconds\n• Microsoft discusses the new Start design and it’s not a s#$t show like it was three years ago\n• No builds for the second Friday in a row\n• Improvements to Settings AI agent, intelligent text actions in Click to Do, a few small changes come to 24H2 in Dev and Beta channels\n• Copilot Vision gets Highlights and 2-App Support across all channels\n• Google’s big Android reveal includes Material Expressive, big Wear OS update. Android, like Windows 11 (and iOS) is just being updated all the time now\n\nWindows 10\n• Extended support program\n• Will support Microsoft 365 on Windows 10 through October 2028\n• Those time frames are identical\n• So what about those Surface PCs that can’t upgrade to Windows 11? Microsoft has an answer (for all unsupported PCs) and it’s not as cynical as you think\n• Microsoft quietly discontinued entry-level 13.8-inch Surface Laptop and 13-inch Surface Pro when it introduced those smaller new models last week\n\nLayoffs\n• Microsoft just made $70 billion, so naturally it’s laying off employees. How to explain this?\n• The FTC’s losing streak against Microsoft continues\n• A proposal for solving the “Mozilla problem” in U.S. v. Google\n• Fortnite could return to the iPhone App Store as soon as today\n\nAI\n• OH MY GOD IS THERE NO AI NEWS FOR ONCE. OK, three small items\n• OpenAI brings OneDrive and SharePoint integration with ChatGPT for paid business customers\n• “AI mode” could replace “I’m feeling lucky” on the Google home page\n• Spotify’s AI DJ keeps improving\n\nDev\n• Build is next week in Seattle, a few thoughts\n• .NET 10 Preview 4 is out\n\nXbox & Games\n• Today’s the day: DOOM: The Dark Ages goes live at 8:00 ET tonight!\n• Xbox Insiders can now play cloud-enabled games with mouse and keyboard\n• Paul reviews the Backbone Pro controller\n• Nintendo revenues slide big ahead of Switch 2 - 15m consoles expected in first year\n• Sony sold 18.5 million PS5s in the most recent fiscal year, down 11 percent YOY\n\nTips & Picks\n• Tip of the week: Windows 11 notifications make iOS look sophisticated\n• App pick of the week: Proton Drive\n• RunAs Radio this week: Active Directory in 2025 with Liz Tesch\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: Limeburners Albany Tawny Cask\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 932\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/932\n\nSponsors:\n• 1password.com/windowsweekly\n• threatlocker.com/twit\n• uscloud.com\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "title": "Flocculation & Saponification - Profanity filter, EU digital commitments, FY25 Q3",
            "description": "YOU ARE THE PRODUCT! But... are you? In Russia, Windows 11 uses you! Plus, something happened to Paul on the way to dual-booting Ubuntu 25.04 on Surface Laptop 7, but all is well! Also, you should be using Brave. But if you don’t like/trust Chromium, Firefox 138 finally added profile management support.\n\nWindows\n• Windows 11 24H2 preview update for April finally arrives\n• Now we know why Microsoft waited: It wanted to announce the “general availability” of Recall, Click to Do, and “improved Windows Search” (we’re still struggling with a name for that one)\n• Dev and Beta (24H2) builds add a profanity filter, a Pen shortcut for Click to Do, improved Windows Search for work and school accounts, Accessibility flyout in Quick settings\n• Microsoft (sort of) explains why Windows Insider Preview channels don’t follow a logical order anymore\n• Microsoft deprecates Map app in Windows 11\n• That makes sense. But also VBS Enclaves in pre-24H2 versions, which is interesting\n\nCorporate\n• Microsoft says it will defend EU companies against US government\n• Alphabet/Google is doing just great, thanks\n• Intel earnings are flat, and that’s as good as that news gets\n• Samsung posts record revenues on strong S25 series sales\n\nDev\n• Build and Google I/O are coming in hot\n• Google is holding a separate Android event for the first time, ahead of I/O\n• What about Surface?             "publishedAt": "2025-04-24T01:43:40Z",
            "channelId": "UC1WHdBv9P5tYEGfy-btvYfA",
            "title": "The Blue Screen of Soup - Agent Store, Oblivion Remastered, Ubuntu 25.04",
            "description": "It’s Week D, do you know where your preview update is? 23H2 is out - 24H2, not so much! No surprises in the new features list, but are more new features on the way? \n\nWindows\n• New text actions in Click to Do - Practice in Reading Coach and Read with Immersive Reader - in Dev and Beta (24H2)\n• Find cloud-based (OneDrive-based) photos using Semantic search - Comes to EEA, Snapdragon X only for now, Dev and Beta\n• Voice access improvements - add words to custom dictionary - Dev and Beta\n• Updated green screen UI - latest Canary build, from today\n• Minor update to the Beta/23H2 channel, no new features\n• Ubuntu 25.04 is out and there’s a native Arm64 ISO (!) and BitLocker support\n• Hands-on with WSL (which is stuck at 24.xx) and in Hyper-V on a Copilot+ PC\n• Is dual-boot even possible on Arm? (Yet)\n• Friday night update to identity caused accounts to be marked as leaked for 50,000 partner accounts\n\nAI\n• We’re in a new wave: Microsoft 365 Copilot updated, new Agent Store and more on the way\n• Copilot Vision is now free for everyone in Microsoft Edge\n• Google is giving Gemini Advanced/Google One AI Premium away for free to US college students\n• Google estimates its Gemini AI chatbot had 35M DAUs and 350M MAUs worldwide as of last month while ChatGPT had 160M DAUs and 600M MAUs (Erin Woo/The Information)\n• Perplexity is coming to Samsung and Motorola phones - and Microsoft is apparently coming to Motorola too\n\nAntitrust\n• It’s getting real - 20 years after US v. Microsoft, Big Tech is finally getting a reckoning\n• Google has now lost two major US antitrust cases in less than a year\n• US v. Google (search): DOJ wants Judge to break up Google\n• US v. Google (ads): Google found to have another illegal monopoly\n• What’s the “right” outcome for Chrome and Google’s ad businesses?\n• OpenAI says it would be happy to buy Chrome from Google- hilarious\n• Google just killed Privacy Sandbox, cites regulatory climate\n• Apple, Meta fined by EU for not conforming to the DMA\n• Apple Intelligence is no longer “available now” (Siri: Is it raining?)\n\nXbox/gaming\n• Elder Scrolls IV Remastered lands on Xbox, PC, PS5 and Game Pass\n• Xbox app arrives on LG smart TVs\n• It’s (back) on: Nintendo Switch 2 pre-orders rescheduled to April 24 with no price change\n• And the demand is higher than expected, Nintendo says\n\nTips and Picks\n• Tip of the week: It’s time to look at Google Fi again\n• HARDWARE pick of the week: Microsoft keyboards and mice are back, baby\n• RunAs Radio this week: Agentic AI for IT Pros with Tim Warner\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: Dark Harmony No. 3 Black IPA Cask\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 929\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/929\n\nSponsor:\n• spaceship.com/twit\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.               "title": "The Blue Screen of Soup - Agent Store, Oblivion Remastered, Ubuntu 25.04",
              "description": "It’s Week D, do you know where your preview update is? 23H2 is out - 24H2, not so much! No surprises in the new features list, but are more new features on the way? \n\nWindows\n• New text actions in Click to Do - Practice in Reading Coach and Read with Immersive Reader - in Dev and Beta (24H2)\n• Find cloud-based (OneDrive-based) photos using Semantic search - Comes to EEA, Snapdragon X only for now, Dev and Beta\n• Voice access improvements - add words to custom dictionary - Dev and Beta\n• Updated green screen UI - latest Canary build, from today\n• Minor update to the Beta/23H2 channel, no new features\n• Ubuntu 25.04 is out and there’s a native Arm64 ISO (!) and BitLocker support\n• Hands-on with WSL (which is stuck at 24.xx) and in Hyper-V on a Copilot+ PC\n• Is dual-boot even possible on Arm? (Yet)\n• Friday night update to identity caused accounts to be marked as leaked for 50,000 partner accounts\n\nAI\n• We’re in a new wave: Microsoft 365 Copilot updated, new Agent Store and more on the way\n• Copilot Vision is now free for everyone in Microsoft Edge\n• Google is giving Gemini Advanced/Google One AI Premium away for free to US college students\n• Google estimates its Gemini AI chatbot had 35M DAUs and 350M MAUs worldwide as of last month while ChatGPT had 160M DAUs and 600M MAUs (Erin Woo/The Information)\n• Perplexity is coming to Samsung and Motorola phones - and Microsoft is apparently coming to Motorola too\n\nAntitrust\n• It’s getting real - 20 years after US v. Microsoft, Big Tech is finally getting a reckoning\n• Google has now lost two major US antitrust cases in less than a year\n• US v. Google (search): DOJ wants Judge to break up Google\n• US v. Google (ads): Google found to have another illegal monopoly\n• What’s the “right” outcome for Chrome and Google’s ad businesses?\n• OpenAI says it would be happy to buy Chrome from Google- hilarious\n• Google just killed Privacy Sandbox, cites regulatory climate\n• Apple, Meta fined by EU for not conforming to the DMA\n• Apple Intelligence is no longer “available now” (Siri: Is it raining?)\n\nXbox/gaming\n• Elder Scrolls IV Remastered lands on Xbox, PC, PS5 and Game Pass\n• Xbox app arrives on LG smart TVs\n• It’s (back) on: Nintendo Switch 2 pre-orders rescheduled to April 24 with no price change\n• And the demand is higher than expected, Nintendo says\n\nTips and Picks\n• Tip of the week: It’s time to look at Google Fi again\n• HARDWARE pick of the week: Microsoft keyboards and mice are back, baby\n• RunAs Radio this week: Agentic AI for IT Pros with Tim Warner\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: Dark Harmony No. 3 Black IPA Cask\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 929\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/929\n\nSponsor:\n• spaceship.com/twit\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "title": "The Rice is Done - Edge 134's speed, Reboot Chime, Altera",
            "description": "Paul, Leo, and Richard get into new Windows features (thanks to the Feature Tracker), hardware shifts for Microsoft/Intel/Apple, AI moves from OpenAI/Apple/Adobe, Notion Mail, a Hawaiian drink, the National Recording Registry, rice cookers, and electronic timer tunes! \n\nWindows 11\n• Feature Tracker. Since we last talked, Microsoft has announced the following new features for Windows 11:\n• Semantic search can now search for Windows settings using natural language - Dev and Beta (24H2) channels, no clear stable date but guessing June\n• Narrator can more accurately describe images by detailing the people, objects, colours, text, and numbers in them, Snapdragon X only, same builds as above\n• Snipping Tool with “Text extraction” in the capture bar - This in Canary now, but it was in at least Dev previously, this could ship in stable at any time, it’s an app\n• Recall (preview) and Click to Do (preview) head to the Release Preview channel (24H2)  - Expect this in May Patch Tuesday\n• Narrator speech recap, Phone Link/Start integration, File Explorer Home updates, Windows Share with Edit all head to Release Preview (23H2) - Expect these in May Patch Tuesday - They were added to Beta channel (23H2) a few days earlier\n• Plus, Microsoft Edge is up to 9 percent faster at web rendering and we’re having a fiesta\n• Also, the Windows 95 startup/logout chime has been inducted into the National Recording Registry\n\nHardware\n• Surface Hub OG hits EOL this year just like Windows 10\n• First major change under new Intel CEO\n• What’s a computer? The iPad, supposedly, but we’ll see\n• Everything’s fine, but Google laid off hundreds in Pixel/Android group\n\nAI\n• Apple is making big changes so that Apple Intelligence will actually be intelligent\n• Adobe is going agentic too\n• OpenAI is creating its own social network because the world needs another social network\n• OpenAI announces three GPT-4.1 models - may retire GPT-4 soon - plus now o3 and o4-mini models\n• ChapGPT gets an image library and a memory\n• Claude gets Research and Google Workspace integration\n• Meta will start training its AI models with EU data, wink wink\n\nXbox and games\n• Xbox app on mobile will soon let you buy games (!) and add-on content, join Game Pass, and redeem perks. Did Microsoft get a concession from Apple/Google??\n• COD: Modern Warfare II (OG) and more are coming to Game Pass in the next few weeks\n• Xbox announces Doom: The Dark Ages limited edition accessories\n• Sea of Thieves is coming to Battle.net\n• Sony forced to raise the price of PS5 in three locales\n\nTips and Picks\n• Tip of the week: Think like an individual, not an enterprise\n• App pick of the week: Notion Mail\n• RunAs Radio this week: How to Not Hate PowerShell with Barbara Forbes\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: 12th Hawaii Distiller’s Reserve\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 928\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/928\n\nSponsors:\n• 1password.com/windowsweekly\n• uscloud.com\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "title": "Up to Stuff - Intel Unison, Quake II WHAMM demo, Minecraft movie",
            "description": "Introducing the Windows 11 Feature Tracker\n\"From the 'I should have done this two years ago' files, the 'I have wasted my life' files, and the, 'great, I needed more work to do' files … There is a need for this. So I made one. But it will evolve. Maybe into a web app/wiki/something else...  like a Notion website?\" - Paul\n• Patch Tuesday brings a metric ton of new features - And what the tracker showed clearly\n• Two seconds after posting the tracker, Microsoft changed the Copilot app yet again - proving the need for the tracker - And demonstrating why the Insider Program is so screwed up\n• A hidden new Start menu in recent builds presents an interesting conundrum: How to handle something Microsoft has not announced?\n\nMore Windows 11\n• Beta build for 23H2: File new tab/new window changes, Explorer context menu regression may be permanent\n• Dev and Beta (24H2): Taskbar icon scaling is a blast from the past we all need desperately\n• Intel is killing Unison app and service\n\nLike winter, Build is coming\n• Build session catalog is live - mostly AI as expected. Paul and Richard are going\n• Overview of the Windows Copilot Runtime (one year after it was announced), Windows Actions, standard Kayla Cinnamon talk on Windows productivity, using your own model with WCR, native app experiences(!), Arm64 app perf, etc.\n\nAI\n• Final thoughts on Microsoft's 50th: Biggest accomplishment wasn’t any tech, it was changing with the times.\n• What it’s best at: Democratizing tech for the commoners, an expansion on Jack Tramiel/Commodore’s “computers for the masses, not the classes” schtick. And that is exactly what it is doing with AI right now\n• Microsoft hosts a consumer AI event and announces a metric ton of new Copilot features\n• We need a Copilot feature tracker. Copilot = every single feature other AIs have - Copilot Actions on the web, memory and personalization, Copilot Vision on mobile and Windows, AI-generated podcasts and Microsoft releases Copilot Search in Bing\n• Is AI turning us all into Charly from Flowers for Algernon?\n• AI is making us stupider! There are studies!!\n• This is the argument against every single tech advance from the steam train to the ballpoint pen to this\n• Microsoft’s AI demo of vibe-coded Quake II highlights the problem nicely\n• Sometimes it’s the little things: AI recaps for book series in Kindle\n• GitHub Copilot updated with Agent Mode, Cursor-style code overviews, more\n\nXbox & gaming\n• Microsoft announces new Xbox Games Showcase for June\n• Edge Game Assist gets new features, support for new games\n• GTA V and enhanced version for PC coming to Game Pass on April 15 - In addition to the previous Game Pass titles we discussed last week\n• Good: Nintendo Switch 2 supports ray tracing and DLSS\n• Bad: Nintendo delays Switch 2 to figure out the tariffs mess\n\nTips and Picks\n• Tip of the week: Programmers at Work\n• App pick of the week: Apple Music\n• RunAs Radio this week: Application Risk in Security Copilot with Ari Schorr\n• Brown liquor pick of the week: The Heart Cut #02\n\nHosts: Leo Laporte, Paul Thurrott, and Richard Campbell\nWindows Weekly episode 927\nMore Info: https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly/episodes/927\n\nDownload or subscribe to Windows Weekly at https://twit.tv/shows/windows-weekly\n\nCheck out Paul's blog at thurrott.com\n\nThe Windows Weekly theme music is courtesy of Carl Franklin.\n\nJoin Club TWiT for Ad-Free Podcasts!\nSupport what you love and get ad-free shows, a members-only Discord, and behind-the-scenes access.             "title": "It's the Shirt - Security Copilot agents, Cursor, AC Shadows",
            "description": "What’s next? Windows 12? Windows 11 25H2? You’re not going to believe what happens next! A look back at everything Microsoft tested in just the Dev channel and then did or did not release to stable, and when. The list of unreleased features is unexpectedly long - most of this must be the next Windows version. Plus, If you have a PC Game Pass or Game Pass Ultimate subscription, there are more benefits now and they’re easier to find.\n\nWindows 11 in 2025\n• Dev channel moves to a new build sequence\n• Microsoft issues Patch Tuesday updates for Windows 10 and Windows 11 23H2 (But not 24H2)\n• Release Preview (24H2) - AI-powered Windows Search experience is barreling towards stable\n• Beta (23H2) and now Canary - Mostly just fixes\n• New AI features in Notepad, Paint, and Snipping tool head to all Insiders\n• Photos app update to all Insiders, adds Copilot integration, more\n\nMicrosoft 365\n• Microsoft 365 Copilot gets two reasoning agents, Researcher and Analyst\n• AI - Agents - Reasoning AI --- Reasoning Agents? You got your reasoning in my agent!\n• Microsoft to launch Security Copilots in April\n• Microsoft releases first two Microsoft 365 companion apps for Windows 11, threatens to make more\n• Here comes Copilot in OneDrive, to consumer Microsoft 365 account holders\n• Anonymous document sharing for Word, Excel, PowerPoint comes to iPhone/iPad (is on web already)\n• OneNote for Windows 10 RIP  in October after years of malaise\n\nAI\n• Browsers to change in the agentic AI era - are they still browsers? Will we still browse?\n• “In Russia, the browser browses for you!”\n• Sam Altman pulls a Bill Gates in executive shift\n• ChatGPT gets image generation with GPT-4o\n• Google brings AI search to Gmail - Hopefully, it’s better than AI search in Photos\n• Google releases first Gemini 2.5 model, all will be reasoning (thinking) models going forward\n• Amazon is testing AI-powered Interests feature in the U.S.\n• After it’s success with conversational Siri, Apple to bring AI to Apple Watch, AirPods\n• Speaking of which, Apple sued for advertising Apple Intelligence - maybe it’s time for a level set here\n• Exec reshuffle to fix Siri woes - maybe it’s time to Ol’ Yeller this\n• WWDC is on for June 9  - [waves hands] Look, it’s iOS 19!\n• Opera upgrades three of its web browsers (really, four) with new Aria AI features\n\nXbox\n• Microsoft wants to make Xbox app in Windows the central hub for all stores\n• Microsoft testing new Game Hub on Xbox\n• Microsoft to release Vibrant Visuals upgrade for Minecraft this year\n• Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is coming to PS5 on April 17\n• New Assassin’s Creed game (Shadows) gets off to a great start, with 2 million players in first 2 days, better than Origins and Odyssey.             "description": "Did Copilot uninstall from your computer recently? You're not alone. At least Microsoft is working on a fix.
